doc:
John McGiver https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_McGiver 0 John Irwin McGiver (November 5, 1913 – September 9, 1975) was an American character actor who made more than a hundred appearances in television and motion pictures over a two-decade span from 1955 to 1975.The owl-faced, portly character actor with his mid-Atlantic accent and precise diction, was often cast as pompous Englishmen and other stuffy, aristocratic and bureaucratic types. He was known for his performances in such films as Breakfast at Tiffany's (1961); The Manchurian Candidate (1962); and Who's Minding the Store? (1963). He appeared on many television shows and commercials during the 1960s and early 1970s, including the very first of a long running popular series of commercials for the American Express charge card ("Do you know me?"). John_Irwin_McGiver ( November_5_,_1913 – September_9_,_1975 ) was an_American_character_actor who made more_than_a_hundred_appearances in television_and_motion_pictures over a_two-decade_span from 1955 to 1975 . The_owl-faced_,_portly_character_actor with his_mid-Atlantic_accent and precise_diction , was_often_cast as pompous_Englishmen and other_stuffy_,_aristocratic_and_bureaucratic_types . He was_known for his_performances in such_films as Breakfast at Tiffany 's_(_1961_) ; The_Manchurian_Candidate_(_1962_) ; and Who 's_Minding the_Store ? (_1963_) . He appeared on many_television_shows_and_commercials during the_1960s and early_1970s , including the_very_first of a_long_running_popular_series of commercials for the_American_Express_charge_card ( " Do_you_know me ? " ) .
